pages.text: Candles are made from tallow most commonly, though wax may be used if available. Candles are both a block-based $(l:world/foci)$(marked)Focus$(), a form of lighting, and a form of decoration. Up to four candles may be placed in one block, and they can be lit with a Flint and Steel.

Altars are key components for rites, as they are used to hold books containing the necessary knowledge. They are also a stronger Rite Focus and come in several variants. One of them is detailed in here.

pages.title: Murals
pages.text: On ancient Shrines one may find Murals dedicated to a specific Great Old One. They contain information not even this book includes, perhaps intentionally. Use a $(marked)Book and Quill$() in order to record what rites or other info is detailed there.
